title: Spanish Property Costs & Taxes: Complete Buyer's Guide 2026
excerpt: All costs involved in buying property in Spain - from purchase taxes to ongoing expenses. IVA, stamp duty, notary fees, and annual taxes explained.
author: New Build Homes Costa Blanca

content.quickAnswer: For new build properties, expect 11.5% on top of purchase price: 10% VAT (IVA) plus 1.5% stamp duty (AJD). Add €3,000-5,000 for notary, registry, and legal fees. Annual costs include IBI (property tax) of 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value, plus community fees if applicable.
content.intro: Understanding the true cost of buying property in Spain prevents surprises and helps you budget accurately. This guide covers every expense from initial deposit to ongoing ownership costs, with specific focus on new build properties in the Valencian Community (Costa Blanca) and Murcia region.

sections.title: Purchase Taxes - New Build vs Resale
sections.content:
**New Build Properties (from developer):**

- **IVA (VAT)**: 10% of purchase price
- **AJD (Stamp Duty)**: 1.5% in Valencia, 2% in Murcia
- **Total tax**: 11.5-12% of purchase price

**Resale Properties (from private seller):**

- **ITP (Transfer Tax)**: 10% in Valencia, 8% in Murcia
- **No VAT applies**
- **Total tax**: 8-10% of purchase price

**Example - New Build €300,000:**
- IVA (10%): €30,000
- AJD (1.5%): €4,500
- Total taxes: €34,500

sections.title: Legal & Professional Fees
sections.content:
**Notary Fees:**
- Regulated by government
- Typically €600-1,500 depending on property price
- Covers deed preparation and signing

**Land Registry:**
- Inscription of your ownership
- Usually €400-800
- Based on property value

**Lawyer/Solicitor:**
- Essential for foreign buyers
- Typically 1% of purchase price (€3,000-5,000 minimum)
- Includes: contract review, due diligence, NIE assistance, completion attendance

**Gestor (Administrative agent):**
- Optional but useful
- €300-500
- Handles utility connections, tax registrations

**Bank charges:**
- Account opening: Usually free
- International transfers: €20-50 per transfer
- Mortgage arrangement: 1% of loan if applicable

sections.title: Ongoing Annual Costs
sections.content:
**IBI (Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles):**
- Annual property tax
- 0.4% to 1.1% of cadastral value
- Cadastral value is typically 30-50% of market value
- Example: €200,000 property = €400-800/year

**Rubbish Collection (Basura):**
- €50-150/year depending on municipality
- Sometimes included in IBI

**Community Fees:**
- If in urbanization or apartment block
- €50-300/month typical
- Covers: gardens, pool, security, building insurance

**Home Insurance:**
- €200-500/year for standard cover
- Required if you have a mortgage

**Non-Resident Income Tax:**
- If not renting: 1.1% of cadastral value × 19% = approx 0.21%
- If renting: 19% of net rental income (EU citizens) or 24% (non-EU)

sections.title: Utility Costs
sections.content:
**Electricity:**
- Connection fee (new build): €200-400
- Monthly: €50-150 depending on usage and AC
- Standing charge: €10-20/month

**Water:**
- Connection fee: €100-200
- Monthly: €20-50
- Higher in summer (pool, garden)

**Gas (if applicable):**
- Not common in Costa Blanca
- Bottled gas for cooking: €15-20 per bottle

**Internet/Phone:**
- Fibre packages: €30-60/month
- Good coverage in most areas

**Pool Maintenance (if private):**
- €100-200/month
- Or €50-100 if maintaining yourself

sections.title: Complete Cost Breakdown Example
sections.content:
**Property price: €350,000 (new build)**

**One-time purchase costs:**
- IVA (10%): €35,000
- AJD (1.5%): €5,250
- Notary: €1,000
- Registry: €600
- Lawyer (1%): €3,500
- Gestor: €400
- Bank account setup: €100
- NIE processing: €150
- **Total one-time: €46,000 (13.1%)**

**Annual ongoing costs:**
- IBI: €600
- Basura: €100
- Community fees: €1,800 (€150/month)
- Insurance: €350
- Non-resident tax: €300
- **Total annual: €3,150**

**Utilities (estimated annual):**
- Electricity: €1,200
- Water: €360
- Internet: €480
- **Total utilities: €2,040**

sections.title: Tax Tips for Buyers
sections.content:
**Claiming back VAT:**
- Not possible for residential property buyers
- Only applies to commercial properties

**Becoming tax resident:**
- Consider implications carefully
- Spanish tax residents pay tax on worldwide income
- Consult a tax advisor before deciding

**Non-resident tax obligations:**
- Annual modelo 210 declaration required
- Even if property is empty, tax is due
- Based on "imputed income" from cadastral value

**Capital gains when selling:**
- 19% on gains for EU residents
- 3% retention at sale for non-residents
- Various allowances and deductions available

**Inheritance planning:**
- Spanish succession tax applies to Spanish assets
- Rates vary by region and relationship
- Early planning can significantly reduce liability

content.conclusion: Budget approximately 13-14% on top of the purchase price for a new build property. Annual running costs vary but expect €3,000-5,000 for a typical villa. Working with a good lawyer ensures all taxes are paid correctly and you understand your ongoing obligations as a Spanish property owner.
